newsitem.title: USA: Sen. Gramm urges appeal of line item veto ruling.
newsitem.headline: Sen. Gramm urges appeal of line item veto ruling.

text.p: Sen. Phil Gramm, R-Texas, Friday urged the Clinton administration to appeal the decision of a federal judge on Thursday that the line item veto law was unconstitutional.

"I'm disappointed that the trial judge has ruled against the line item veto, but I am confident that his ruling is flawed and that the law will be upheld if the Clinton administration follows through on its plan to appeal," Gramm said in a statement.
The law allows the president to veto individual items in appropriations bills without rejecting the entire bill.
